config.question: In 1996, Republicans had control of both houses, but despite this, Democrat Bill Clinton was reelected president because of __________.

choices.content: the Republicans’ stand on budget issues
the successful ending of the Cold War and destruction of the Soviet Union
Clinton’s public image as trustworthy and squeaky-clean
revelations of wrongdoing by his Republican challenger during the 1996 campaign

answer_3.response: Clinton turned deadlock to his benefit in 1996 after the Republicans, having failed to force him to accept cuts in Medicare, college loans, and other social services, refused to pass a budget bill, and thereby shut down the federal government. Clinton persuaded voters that the Republicans were to blame and carried this theme into his 1996 reelection campaign.
